author: nhcwebmaster@noaa.gov (NHC Webmaster)
nhc_headline: ...BERYL STILL A VERY DANGEROUS CATEGORY 4 HURRICANE... ...LIFE-THREATENING WINDS AND STORM SURGE EXPECTED TO BEGIN SOON FOR PORTIONS OF THE WINDWARD ISLANDS...
summary:
...BERYL STILL A VERY DANGEROUS CATEGORY 4 HURRICANE... ...LIFE-THREATENING WINDS AND STORM SURGE EXPECTED TO BEGIN SOON FOR PORTIONS OF THE WINDWARD ISLANDS...
 As of 11:00 PM AST Sun Jun 30
 the center of Beryl was located near 11.5, -58.1
 with movement W at 20 mph.
 The minimum central pressure was 959 mb
 with maximum sustained winds of about 130 mph.
